https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A predictive tool typically used for mineral exploration targeting at the broad regional- to camp-scale. It is less effective and less frequently used at the project- to deposit-scale where predictive tools compete with direct detection techniques. It includes the delineation of prospective areas based on personal experience and interpretation of available geological, geochemical and geophysical data, as well as statistical data analysis/modelling, and in combination GIS-based spatial datasets and/or soft computational models (e.g. fuzzy logic).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
Definition adapted from:
Porwal, AK and Kreuzer, OP 2010, Introduction to the Special Issue: Mineral prospectivity analysis and quantitative resource estimation: Ore Geology Reviews, v. 38(3), p. 121-127, doi:10.1016/j.oregeorev.2010.06.002.
